Event.name: Arraignment
Event.definition:
<def-root>At a court hearing, a <fen>Defendant</fen> is informed of the <fen>Charges</fen> against him or her, (usually) enters a plea, and a decision is made by a <fen>Judge</fen> as to the amount of bail, if any. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Defendant">Mortimer and Isabella</fex> were hurried off and <t>arraigned</t> <fex name="Judge">before parliament</fex> <fex name="Time">in November</fex>.</ex>
<ex>If the court rejects the appeal, <fex name="Defendant">the 19 young men</fex> face<m></m><t>arraignment</t> <fex name="Charges">on murder charges</fex> <fex name="Judge">before the tribunal</fex> <fex name="Place">in the southern city of Port Harcourt</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Defendant
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Defendant</fen> is charged with a crime by a <fen>Judge</fen>. <ex> <fex name="Defendant">Jan</fex> was <t>arraigned</t> on eight counts of treason.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arraignment occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arraignment occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Judge
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Judge</fen> is the head of the court where the arraignment occurs. <ex> Jan was <t>arraigned</t> on eight counts of treason <fex name="Judge">before Duncan Smith</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Charges
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Charges</fen> is the crime with which the <fen>Defendant</fen> is charged. <ex>Jan was <t>arraigned</t> <fex name="Charges">on eight counts of treason</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the arraignment takes.
<ex>Just a <fex name="Dur">short</fex> little <t>arraignment</t>, and then you'll walk, alright?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the arraignment which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (openly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Judge</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
<ex>Everyone 's always <fex name="Manner">very carefully</fex> <t>arraigned</t> before they meet trial, don't you worry none.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: arraign.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: call before a court to answer a criminal charge

lexUnit.name: arraignment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the calling of a defendant before a court to answer a criminal charge
